Description: Digital photograph (colour); view of painted rock art on a rock face (sandstone?) showing a composite mythical animal figure, painted and infilled in dark brown. It is upright and facing right, apparently incorporating an elephant’s face, an equid’s forequarters, human feet and a long thin tail. The animal’s limbs are outstretched suggesting movement. A 5cm scale has been fitted at the bottom of the image. Wadi Anak, Egypt. Scanned
Curator's comments: Detail of 2013.2034.46. See also: 2013.2034.46 & 2013.2034.48. This site is a long, sloping shelter running up and under the protected side of an inselberg.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Trust for African Rock Art
